programme.title: The Wood Whisperer: Flexible Sanding Strip
programme.desc: The first time I saw a flexible sanding strip in action was while watching an episode of Woodworks going on almost 10 years ago. David Marks incorporates lots of curves in his work and the man knows a thing or two about making them. Since then, I have made numerous sanding strips in all shapes and sizes and my curves are about as perfect and smooth as they can be.

programme.title: The Wood Whisperer: Flattening Workbenches and Wide Boards with a Router
programme.desc: The traditional method for flattening a workbench is to use hand planes and winding sticks. While some folks truly relish this labor of love, others prefer to delegate this grunt work to power tools. The power tool method is very similar to the action of a CNC machine. The router sled is very easy to make from scrap 3/4 inch plywood. The rails can be made from 2 by 6 construction-grade lumber.

programme.title: The Wood Whisperer: Flatten Boards Wider Than Your Jointer
programme.desc: I'm going to show you two techniques that will help you keep your wide boards intact. Both methods utilize the planer for final flattening, but one method starts with a hand plane and the other starts with the jointer.

programme.title: The Wood Whisperer: Fixing Common Woodworking Mistakes
programme.desc: Whether we like to admit it or not, mistakes will happen. Knowing how to repair them may make the difference between a nerve-wracking build and a relaxed one. So in this demo (recorded live), I'll show you some of the most common mistakes and errors I encounter and the various ways I like to fix them.

programme.title: The Wood Whisperer: Fixing a Knot
programme.desc: Ever find yourself short on material and that one board you really need has a nice open knot in it? You could always go out and buy more material, but sometimes its just easier and faster to stabilize and repair the knot. And instead of trying to hide the knot, sometimes its just better to embrace it, and make it look look resinous and natural.

programme.title: The Wood Whisperer: Finishing the Arts & Crafts Table
programme.desc: In this episode, Marc shows how to add a curve to the bottom rails and the sides of your arts & crafts table.

programme.title: Learn to Crochet
programme.desc: Have you always wanted to learn how to Crochet? Well now's your chance to have a lesson in the comfort of your own home. This easy to follow step by step programme will teach you the basics to get started and then move you onb to some simple projects such as making bunting and a crochet basket. You will find out what equipment you'll need, learn different crochet stitches and look at finishing techniques.

programme.title: Hooked for Life: Learn to Tunisian Crochet
programme.desc: Mary Beth Temple teaches the basics of Tunisian crochet.

programme.title: FaveCrafts: How to Make a Spring Wreath
programme.desc: Watch this DIY video tutorial to learn How to make a Spring Wreath. Adding colorful spring wreaths to your home is a fabulous way to make your space blossom with very little effort. Follow along with this home decor craft tutorial to create a stunning and bright project. This DIY craft is easy to make, and you can use just about any fabric you would like. Get started on your own DIY wreath for the most cheerful of seasons!

programme.title: FaveCrafts: Toolbox Father's Day Craft
programme.desc: While picking out the perfect gift for dad can be tempting, sometimes a gift card is an even better idea. As they say, it is the thought that counts! With this Toolbox Fathers Day Craft, you can learn how to make the perfect gift for dad. By creating a DIY craft to keep the gift card tucked into, you give your dad some handmade love and something useful at the same time. Plus, you could easily use this homemade box to wrap up some homemade candies, as well.

programme.title: For What It's Worth: Episode 1
programme.desc: For What It's Worth is an exciting and compelling new quiz show hosted by Fern Britton who is assisted by a different BBC antiques expert each day.

programme.title: For What It's Worth: Episode 2
programme.desc: For What It's Worth is an exciting and compelling new quiz show hosted by Fern Britton who is assisted by a different BBC antiques expert each day.

programme.title: For What It's Worth: Episode 3
programme.desc: For What It's Worth is an exciting and compelling new quiz show hosted by Fern Britton who is assisted by a different BBC antiques expert each day.

programme.title: The Stitchery: 4 Fun Stitches for Beginner and Intermediate Embroiderers Alike!
programme.desc: Pistil, Coral, Feather, and Fly Stitch Tutorials

programme.title: She's Crafty: 21st Century Craft
programme.desc: Crafting a used table into a hip ottoman and an old school audio cassette into a funky business card holder.

programme.title: She's Crafty: Take It Outside
programme.desc: Tie-dye wall art and handmade picture frames!

programme.title: She's Crafty: Style Galore
programme.desc: Recycle a garage-sale lamp and turn into an outdoorsy design. Plus, have fun with collage. Create a gorgeous art journal.

programme.title: She's Crafty: Eco Weddings
programme.desc: Knitting a laptop bag; reinventing ways to reuse an old shirt.

programme.title: She's Crafty: Simply Green
programme.desc: Wendy shows us how to expose favorite pictures in a crafty tripod shelf. Plus, showcase your favorite things with some glittery love shrines.

programme.title: She's Crafty: Craft Outside the Box
programme.desc: Joined by her closest friends, Wendy shows us some simple crafts to add to our collection.

programme.title: She's Crafty: Dress Your Naked Walls
programme.desc: Knitting maverick Vicky Howell joins Wendy is making funky knitwear. Plus learn how to make a table from an old closet door.

programme.title: The Wood Whisperer: End Grain Glue Myths
programme.desc: A recent video discussed how much stronger end grain joints are than we assumed, but some folks misinterpreted the data.

programme.title: The Wood Whisperer: Elevated Dog Bowl - WFC 2019
programme.desc: A fun project for your four-legged pals.

programme.title: The Wood Whisperer: Edge Banding aka On The Edge
programme.desc: Marc teaches how to fix up ugly edges on your projects.

programme.title: The Wood Whisperer: Ebony Plugs
programme.desc: We focus on pillowing ebony pegs, an adornment commonly found in Greene & Greene style furniture.

programme.title: The Wood Whisperer: French Cleat Storage System
programme.desc: A French cleat is as ingenious as it is simple. It involves securing a strip of wood with a 45 degree bevel to the wall, and then securing an opposing beveled strip on the back of a cabinet or anything you want to hang. Its incredibly strong and versatile. Its a great way to hang cabinetry and as you’ll see in this video, it can be used to make an awesome modular wall storage unit.

programme.title: The Wood Whisperer: Fortnite Sign Via CNC
programme.desc: A CNC-cut Fortnite sign for my son's birthday!

programme.title: Pure Design: Lindsay's Teenage Bedroom
programme.desc: Designer Samantha Pynn creates an eco-fabulous bedroom for 16-year-old Lindsay that perfectly balances youthful without looking childish - and still allows for room to grow.

programme.title: Pure Design: Carolyn & Derek's Attic Loft
programme.desc: Designer Samantha Pynn transforms an unimaginative third floor loft into a fun, colorful, bohemian-inspired family room that matches homeowners Carolyn and Derek's personalities.

programme.title: Pure Design: Ania & Walter's Master Bedroom
programme.desc: Too much space is not always a good thing, but with a little planning, designer Samantha Pynn is able to transform Ania and Walter's vast bedroom into a luxurious, earth-friendly boudoir.
